title: ‘This time bullet won’t miss target’: Iran airs clip of Trump's 2024 assassination attempt
content: Iranian state television aired footage showing a threat against US President Donald Trump, displaying a placard with his image and a message implying a failed assassination attempt. This direct threat follows Trump's warnings of military action against Iran amid ongoing anti-government protests and previous Iranian plots against him.

title: Explained: Can the Nobel Peace Prize be transferred?
content: Machado presented Trump with the medal she received after being awarded the Nobel Peace Prize last year. Trump publicly praised her, calling her a “wonderful woman”, and described the act as one of mutual respect. The White House later confirmed that Trump intends to keep the medal.

title: Apple's $1 billion AI deal: Why Google won; what OpenAI got wrong
content: Apple has inked a  multi-year deal with Google, reportedly worth $1 billion annually, to power its next-generation Siri features with Gemini AI models. This strategic move comes after Apple tested various AI contenders, including OpenAI and Anthropic, ultimately choosing Google for its competitive terms and advanced capabilities.

title: High drama on IndiGo flight: Mumbai-Krabi passengers turn aggressive over long delay
content: Two IndiGo passengers were deboarded and handed over to security after becoming unruly during a significant delay on a Mumbai to Krabi flight. The flight, scheduled for a 4:05 am departure, eventually left at 1:21 pm due to operational issues. Videos show passengers arguing with a flight attendant and one kicking the aircraft door.

title: Infosys share price today: IT giant jumps 5% after guidance hike
content: Infosys shares surged over 5% after the IT giant boosted its FY26 revenue growth forecast to 3-3.5%. Despite a slight dip in Q3 net profit, revenue saw a 9% year-on-year rise. Brokerages remain largely positive, citing strong deal wins and signs of recovery in key sectors, though near-term performance views vary.

title: 2027 WC: Nitish Reddy’s lean returns raise doubts over Hardik backup plan
content: Nitish Kumar Reddy, a seam-bowling allrounder, remains a puzzle for the Indian team management despite being seen as a key player. Captain Shubman Gill and others have shown reluctance to give him a significant role, raising questions about his future.  Selectors aim to develop him as a backup for Hardik Pandya ahead of the 2027 World Cup.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14B, now they're clashing: AI team in chaos; new boss moves in
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: 'Wonderful gesture': How Trump reacted to Machado 'presenting' her Nobel medal — did he keep it?
content: US President Donald Trump received a Nobel Peace Prize medal from Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, calling her a "wonderful woman." Machado presented the award as recognition for Trump's commitment to freedom. This follows recent US strikes that toppled President Maduro, though Trump later expressed doubts about Machado's leadership potential.

title: Tesla ends FSD sale: To be available only as subscription; Elon Musk’s $1T pay may be reason
content: Tesla will cease selling its Full Self-Driving software outright after February 14, 2026, shifting to a monthly subscription model. This move is reportedly linked to Elon Musk's ambitious $1 trillion compensation package, which includes a target of 10 million active FSD subscriptions.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 rises above 25,800; BSE Sensex up over 700 points
content: Indian stock markets opened higher today, with Nifty50 and BSE Sensex showing gains. Analysts anticipate a range-bound market as investors await corporate earnings and budget announcements. Despite positive global cues and strong Q3 results from some companies, FII selling is expected to cap significant upward movement, presenting opportunities for long-term investors.

title: Rupee in red: Currency drops 10 paise to 90.44 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee declined for a third consecutive session, falling 10 paise to 90.44 against the US dollar due to persistent foreign fund outflows and a stronger greenback. While declining crude oil prices and positive equity markets offered some support, a widening trade deficit and lower expectations of a Fed rate cut added pressure.

title: Bangladesh cricket crisis: BPL to resume after day-long drama; sacked BCB director apologises
content: Bangladesh cricketers ended their boycott of the BPL 2025-26 after controversial director Najmul Islam issued a public apology and was removed from his finance committee role. The standoff, triggered by Najmul's remarks about Tamim Iqbal and player compensation, saw matches postponed. Players agreed to return to action following a meeting with the BCB and CWAB.

title: Kyle Tucker vs Shohei Ohtani net worth: Who’s richer and why
content: Shohei Ohtani boasts a net worth of approximately $150 million, significantly more than Kyle Tucker's estimated $60 million. Ohtani's wealth stems from a historic $700 million Dodgers contract and substantial endorsements, while Tucker's earnings come from his MLB salary and a recent $240 million deal.  Ohtani also leads in endorsements and real estate investments.

title: T20 World Cup: Injury blow! Washington Sundar setback forces change in plans
content: All-rounder Washington Sundar's side strain is more serious than initially thought, casting doubt on his availability for the T20 World Cup's initial stages. The team management is preparing backup plans, with a decision on his participation pending a full medical assessment. Other injury concerns also loom for the Indian squad.

title: Electronics prices to rise? Laptops, smartphones & more likely to get expensive
content: Get ready for a price hike on electronics! Smartphones, TVs, and laptops are set to become costlier by 4-8% in the coming weeks, following significant jumps in November and December.  Soaring memory chip prices, driven by AI demand, are the main culprit. Experts warn these increases could become a regular occurrence, impacting immediate consumer demand.

title: 10-year-old takes mother’s body alone for autopsy after HIV death
content: A 10-year-old boy in Etah bravely brought his mother's body for a post-mortem alone after she succumbed to tuberculosis and HIV. Orphaned by the same disease the previous year, the child faced isolation until police intervened to arrange her final rites. Distant relatives eventually arrived, offering solace to the grieving boy.

title: Thyroid trouble starts before labs say anything’s wrong: Doctors share early symptoms
content: Modern life's relentless pace and poor lifestyle choices are overwhelming our bodies, particularly impacting the thyroid. Subtle symptoms like fatigue, weight gain, and mood swings are often dismissed, leading to delayed diagnosis.  These quiet signals, if ignored, can result in serious health complications affecting metabolism, heart health, and digestion over time.

title: Sacred swag: Confluence of faith and luxury at Magh Mela
content: At Prayagraj's Magh Mela, a spiritual leader arrived in a Rs 3 crore Porsche, showcasing a blend of devotion and luxury.  His opulent car collection, along with other seers sporting gold jewelry and makeup, is drawing significant attention.  These displays are seen by followers as symbols of faith, not arrogance, adding a glamorous dimension to the religious gathering.

title: IND vs NZ: Gambhir seeks blessings at Mahakaleshwar Temple ahead of ODI decider – watch
content: Indian cricket coach Gautam Gambhir sought blessings at Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple before the crucial ODI series decider against New Zealand. He participated in the Bhasma Aarti and expressed contentment with the temple's arrangements. The three-match series is currently tied at 1-1, with the final match set to determine the winner.

title: US peace plan for Gaza: Trump announces ‘board of peace’— what it means
content: US President Trump announced the formation of a Gaza “board of peace,” a key step in the second phase of a US-backed plan to end the war. This board will supervise a Palestinian technocratic committee tasked with Gaza's administration post-conflict. The plan also includes an International Stabilisation Force, though major issues remain unresolved.

title: Ranchi ED office raid: Police raid triggers legal, political standoff
content: In a dramatic turn of events, Ranchi police conducted a raid on the regional office of the Enforcement Directorate following an alarming grievance from an employee who reported a 'deadly attack' during questioning.

title: Modified trouble: Kerala student’s flame-spitting car draws Rs 1.1L fine in Bengaluru
content: A Kerala student's quest for social media fame backfired spectacularly in Bengaluru, landing him with a Rs 1.1 lakh fine for illegally modifying his car. The souped-up Honda City, spewing flames and roaring loudly, drew widespread complaints and official action.  Authorities imposed penalties exceeding the car's purchase price, a stark lesson in responsible vehicle use.

title: 'Expected better human': Cricketer lashes out at Mary Kom; later deletes video
content: Cricketer Manoj Tiwary expressed deep hurt over Mary Kom's public statements about her ex-husband, Karung Onkholer Kom, highlighting the crucial role of a support system for athletes. Tiwari emphasized the importance of mutual contribution in relationships and voiced concern for Onkholer's mental well-being following the public dispute over alleged financial misconduct.

title: Nilgai crashes through car windshield, kills 4-year-old sitting in mother’s lap
content: A four-year-old girl tragically died after a nilgai jumped onto the car she was in on a Guna highway. The animal crashed through the windshield, fatally striking the child and injuring her parents. Forest officials rescued and are treating the nilgai.

title: 'Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos' first reviews out
content: Vir Das and Kavi Shashtri's directorial 'Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos' is set to release this Friday, January 16. Early reviews from Fatima Sana Sheikh and Triptii Dimri praise the film as a fun, entertaining spy comedy. The movie, starring Vir Das in his directorial debut, also features a notable cameo from Aamir Khan.

title: Patrick Mahomes stays low-key as Brittany Mahomes marks milestone amid recovery doubts
content: Patrick Mahomes is staying largely out of the public eye as he continues his rehab following a season-ending knee injury. While his recovery timeline remains uncertain, his wife Brittany recently shared a family milestone, drawing attention to the quieter phase of Mahomes’ career as he balances healing, home life, and preparation for his return.

title: LeBron James pens two-word message for Kyle Lowry’s Toronto standing ovation
content: Toronto Raptors fans gave a heartfelt standing ovation to former star Kyle Lowry during his return, even as his 76ers team secured a win.  LeBron James lauded the touching sportsmanship with a social media post. Lowry, who spent nine years with the Raptors, called the moment a career highlight, cherishing the team's gesture.

title: Travis Kelce, Taylor Swift relationship strained over his life after football
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about Travis Kelce’s emotional well-being as he considers retirement from the NFL. Insiders say football has long defined Kelce’s identity, making the transition difficult. While opportunities await beyond the game, the uncertainty has created stress. Kelce has acknowledged the challenge publicly while evaluating his physical readiness and future.

title: 'Dump' yard? Bird poop halts play in India Open; TV cameras ignore break
content: In an unexpected turn of events, the India Open badminton tournament faced interruptions not from the players, but from nature itself, as bird droppings halted a tense showdown between H S Prannoy and Loh Kean Yew. While commentators initially downplayed the situation, the competitors confirmed that the feathery interlopers were indeed the culprits.

title: Budget 2026: The urgent need to tackle long-pending and long drawn-out tax litigation
content: As India positions itself as a preferred investment destination, the credibility of its tax dispute resolution system will be closely watched by both domestic and global investors.

title: Defamation case filed against Khushi Mukherjee over Suryakumar claim
content: Social media influencer Faizan Ansari has filed a Rs 100 crore defamation case against actress Khushi Mukherjee on January 13, following her remarks about Indian T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav. The legal action comes after Mukherjee claimed in an earlier interview that Suryakumar “used to message me a lot.”

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for January 16 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends RBL Bank, and UPL as the top stock picks for January 16, 2026. It also shares its view on Nifty and Bank Nifty:

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection: Film ends week 6 with Rs 1,272 cr haul
content: Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, crossing Rs 25 crore in its sixth week. Despite a dip in collections, the film has amassed a staggering Rs 816.60 crore net in India and is nearing the Rs 1,000 crore gross mark, aiming to surpass 'KGF Chapter 2'.

title: Patrick Mahomes injury update: Chiefs QB sets early return goal after ACL surgery
content: Patrick Mahomes shared his first update after undergoing ACL surgery, saying his recovery is progressing well and that his goal is to be ready for Week 1 of the 2026 season. While acknowledging the long rehab ahead, the Kansas City Chiefs star remains optimistic, hopes to take part in OTAs, and has ruled out retirement.

title: Security forces fully prepared to tackle emerging challenges in J&K: Dulloo
content: The J&K Chief Secretary said multiple challenges persist, ranging from infiltration attempts to weather-related and terrain-specific difficulties, which are often exploited by adversarial elements

title: Unnao rape: Survivor moves Delhi HC to place more material in Kuldeep Sengar's appeal
content: In her application filed in the expelled BJP leader's appeal, she said she wanted to place before the court facts and documents to show "relevant recent developments" as well as the threat to herself and her family

title: Coast Guard seizes Pakistani boat with nine crew members for illegally entering Indian waters
content: The boat is being towed to Porbandar by an ICG ship for thorough “rummaging” and joint interrogation of the crew by agencies concerned

title: Noida schools up to Class 8 to remain closed on Jan 16, 17 due to cold
content: "All schools from Nursery to Class 8 affiliated with CBSE, ICSE, IB, UP Board, and other boards operating in Gautam Buddh Nagar district shall remain closed on January 16 and 17," says the order

title: Right to self-determination mustn’t be abused to encourage secession: India slams Pakistan at U.N.
content: Pakistan repeatedly raises the issue of Jammu and Kashmir at the United Nations and its various platforms but fails to get any traction from the wider international community on the matter

title: One more held for 'involvement' in bomb explosion at Manipur fuel station
content: “The 41-year-old accused was apprehended from the Lamphel Sana Keithel area in Imphal West district on January 16, and a cache of arms and ammunition was recovered from his possession,” says a senior officer

title: Meta, Amazon, Flipkart, Meesho fined for illegal walkie-talkie sales
content: Notices were issued to 13 e-commerce entities: Chimiya, JioMart, Talk Pro, Meesho, MaskMan Toys, TradeIndia, Antriksh Technologies, Vardaanmart, IndiaMart, Meta Platforms Inc. (Facebook Marketplace), Flipkart, Krishna Mart, and Amazon

title: Focused strategy to transform Andhra Pradesh into a knowledge hub, says CM Naidu
content: Emphasising tradition, the Chief Minister said Sankranti symbolises gratitude to elders and reverence for nature, while the harvest season reflects the prosperity of farmers.

title: Why is BMC result likely to get delayed today?
content: Mumbaikars voted on the 10,231 polling booths and cast their ballots to choose from the 1700 candidates in the fray

title: Zubeen Garg case: CM refuses to comment on Singapore court hearing; wife seeks truth through FB post
content: In a Facebook post, Garima Saikia Garg pledged the family's complete support to investigations, urged the Indian government to ‘monitor’ the proceedings in Singapore, and take all necessary diplomatic steps to ensure that every relevant fact is placed before it

title: 52.94% turnout recorded in Mumbai civic polls; down from 55.53% in last elections in 2017
content: The last BMC polls were held in 2017 with a voter turnout of 55.53%, and the term of the elected body ended in March 2022

title: Watch: How Nashik has thwarted the government’s plan to hack trees in Tapovan so far
content: Residents of Nashik are protesting against the proposed felling of trees at Tapovan, a site of deep historical, religious and ecological significance.

title: High-level panel formed to examine digital arrest issues: MHA tells SC
content: Earlier in December last year, the apex court had asked the CBI to carry out a unified pan-India probe into digital arrest scam cases. It had passed the directions in a suo motu case registered on the complaint of an elderly couple from Haryana

title: Suspect arrested for tearing banner and vandalism in temple in Puranapul in Hyderabad
content: A separate case was registered in connection with the attack on the police and the vandalism carried out by the mob

title: Delhi’s minimum temperature rises to 4.3°C as cold snap subsides
content: Safdarjung station’s 4.3°C was 3.3 notches below the normal. Palam recorded a minimum of 4.7°C, 2.8 notches below normal, while Lodhi Road logged 4.7°C, 1.3 notches below normal.

title: Pilots' body FIP serves legal notice to AAIB in relation to Ahmedabad plane crash probe
content: AAIB has summoned Captain Varun Anand, nephew of the late Sabharwal and a pilot of narrow-body aircraft with Air India

title: ₹4.71 lakh crore investment realised in 11 months: Karnataka Industries Minister M.B. Patil
content: State moving towards rapid progress following the Global Investors’ Meet, claims the minister who will be attending the World Economic Forum at Davos from January 19 to 23

title: Sri Siddaramanand Puri Swamiji laid to rest with state honours at Raichur’s Kanaka Guru Peetha ground
content: The Peethadhipathi of Kanaka Guru Peetha, Swamiji passed away in the early hours of Thursday (January 15, 2026)

title: Drones sighted along India-Pakistan border in J&K’s Poonch, Samba
content: The drones were seen hovering along the Line of Control (LoC) in Poonch and the Ramgarh sector of Samba district

title: Govt offices attacked during SIR hearings in West Bengal
content: After attack on the BDO office at Farakka in Murshidabad district on Wednesday, thousands of locals vandalised BDO office at Chakulia in Uttar Dinajpur district

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Young voters left confused over new alliances in Mumbai
content: Trends indicate the BJP has slowly increased its hold in the BMC, traditionally dominated by the Thackerays

title: Punjab CM Mann appears before Akal Takht Secretariat to clarify remarks on Sikh traditions
content: Before appearing before the Takht Secretariat, where he was present for more than an hour, Mr. Mann offered prayers at the Golden Temple

title: India planning evacuation of nationals from Iran: Official sources
content: Iran had temporarily closed its airspace on January 14, but reopened it on January 15, which has increased the chances of India sending aircraft to Tehran

title: Tripura CM ready to accept Roman script for Kokborok language, Tipra Motha claims
content: Tipra Motha leaders said CM Manik Saha confirmed the State government’s readiness to introduce the Roman script in all levels of examinations under the Tripura Board of Secondary Education (TBSE), CBSE and ICSE

title: Can’t we presume that voters who survived multiple roll revisions are citizens, Supreme Court poses petitioners’ query to ECI
content: The question from the CJI-led Bench came in the backdrop of discussions over a 1995 Supreme Court case law, which held that a person already enrolled in the voter list should not be asked to prove citizenship

title: A.R. Rahman says Hindi film industry has changed over past eight years: ‘It could be a communal thing’
content: A.R. Rahman said he was the first composer from the South who went to the Hindi film industry and survived it

title: Maharashtra civic polls: In battle for Mumbai, exit polls predict clear win for BJP-Shiv Sena alliance
content: The Shiv Sena (UBT) and the MNS, which contested polls independently, are expected to win five and two seats, respectively in the BMC polls.

title: Kerala School Kalolsavam 2026: When theatre moved beyond borders
content: The High School drama competiton at the State School Art Festival hit hard with tales of conflict and compassion and conscience in front of a full house

title: ‘Murder’ of democracy: Opposition claims irregularities in Maharashtra civic polls
content: Polling for 29 municipal corporations across Maharashtra on January 15 drew sharp political reactions, with Mumbai’s high-stakes BMC contest at the centre. Opposition parties alleged voting irregularities, including concerns over indelible ink, voter lists and polling procedures, while election authorities rejected the claims and said complaints were being examined.

title: U.S. seizes Venezuela-linked tanker ahead of Trump-Machado meeting
content: The seizure ​marks the sixth vessel targeted in recent weeks that was either carrying Venezuelan oil or had done so in the past. The officials, speaking on the condition of anonymity, said the seizure took place in the Caribbean

title: Barabanki MP says Uttar Pradesh SIRs show rural voters exceed total number of voters in State; SC asks Election Commission to explain
content: ‘After the Assembly SIR, the total number of voters in U.P. is shown as 12.56 crore, reflecting a reduction of about 2.89 crore voters. After the Panchayat SIR, the number of rural voters alone is shown as 12.69 crore, reflecting an increase of about 40 lakh voters,’ the note read

title: Odisha’s Sundargarh clash: Educational institutes shut on Jan. 16 as curbs imposed, internet suspended; at least 12 injured
content: The DIG of Odisha Police informed that the clash erupted around 2.30 p.m. over dispute on some “food item” and the situation remained under control since 5 p.m

title: Democracy delivers in India as people are at centre of governance, says PM Modi
content: About 61 speakers and presiding officers from 42 Commonwealth nations are attending the CSPOC which is being hosted by India for the fourth time

title: AI, emerging tech have increased efficiency of democracy, says Om Birla; cautions against misuse
content: The Lok Sabha Speaker said the use of AI and digital technologies was steadily increasing in the Parliament and State Legislatures

title: Top EU leaders to visit India as Republic Day guests; likely to sign trade deal
content: Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal says both sides very close to EU-India trade deal, “sensitive agricultural” items to be left out

title: Watch: The making of ‘atchu vellam’, an ingredient in sweet Pongal
content: Veeramangudi, in Papanasam taluk of Tamil Nadu’s Thanjavur district, is known for its production of the soft and crumbly atchu vellam (jaggery set into cubical wooden moulds). Factories in and around the village produce approximately 245 tonnes of jaggery (7,000 bags of 35 kg each) annually. Of late though, these factories have started closing down due to an attack of yellow leaf disease in the sugarcane crop.

title: Panic grips Kashmiri parents as wards go incommunicado after Iran internet shutdown, street protests
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Students Association (JKSA) claimed that the first batch of students is likely to return to India on Friday (January 16, 2026)

title: Donna Kelce faces backlash over controversial casting on The Traitors US
content: Donna Kelce faced online backlash after her casting on The Traitors US, with fans accusing producers of setting her up to fail. Viewers criticized her Secret Traitor role, arguing she lacked reality TV experience. While some defended her reserved approach, many felt the casting choice was unfair and driven more by publicity than gameplay.

title: Watch: Pongal celebrations light up Pudukottai
content: Residents of Meivazhi Salai in Tamil Nadu’s Pudukkottai district came together to celebrate the Pongal festival with joy, tradition and community spirit on Thursday. From festive decorations to ritual cooking of Pongal, the harvest festival reflected gratitude, unity and cultural pride.

title: 52 Maoists carrying ₹1.41 crore as reward surrender in Bijapur
content: As part of the rehabilitation process, immediate financial assistance of ₹50,000 was provided to each cadre as an incentive

title: Deal with U.S. ‘very near’, teams are engaging virtually on pending issues: Commerce Secretary
content: The latest trade data, released on January 15, 2026, showed that India’s merchandise exports to the U.S. stood at a five-month high of $7.01 billion in December 2025, up from $6.89 in December 2024

title: Bengal SIR: Election Commission declines proposal to accept Class 10 admit card as valid document
content: The ECI noted that in accordance with the instructions issued on October 27, 2025, the madhyamik admit card is not recognised as a valid document for verification purposes

title: ‘Serious indictment’ of Mamata: BJP over Supreme Court observation on ED plea in I-PAC raid caseami
content: Supreme court stayed the FIR filed in West Bengal against ED officials who raided the I-PAC office and the residence of its director, Pratik Jain, on January 8, 2026 and directed the State police to protect the CCTV footage of the raids.

title: Watch: How Tamil Nadu celebrated Pongal
content: Tamil Nadu erupted in festive joy on January 15 as across the state celebrated ‘Thai Pongal’, the traditional harvest festival, with religious fervour and gaiety.

title: We are preparing for future wars; indigenisation key for self-reliance: Army Chief
content: General Dwivedi said that special emphasis is being placed on resources that are useful for both military and civilian purposes, contributing to the overall development of the country

title: Exports rise 1.87% to $38.5 billion in December: Commerce Secretary
content: Despite global uncertainties, India's exports are recording positive growth, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal says

title: Air India aircraft grounded after engine ingests cargo container; DGCA launches probe
content: The aircraft was operating a New Delhi–New York flight and returned to Delhi shortly after departure due to Iranian airspace restrictions

title: Uddhav Thackeray claims irregularities in Maharashtra civic polls, calls it 'murder' of democracy
content: The former Chief Minister also demanded the suspension of the State Election Commissioner over alleged irregularities in the municipal corporation polls

title: Omar speaks to Jaishankar on J&K students caught in Iran turmoil
content: The parents of Kashmiri students studying in Iran have appealed to the Centre to bring their children back amid the ongoing tensions

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on plea to withdraw life-sustaining treatment for Harish Rana
content: The hearing highlighted the importance of the family taking a “consistent and well-considered” decision

title: CBI conducts searches in various parts of Kolkata in bank fraud case
content: The searches were being conducted at the residence of a businessman in the city's New Alipore area, and in New Town near the city, among other places, they said

title: BSP to contest all elections alone, including 2027 U.P. Assembly polls: Mayawati
content: There should be no confusion about this. The Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) will contest the next Assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh alone, says BSP president Mayawati

title: Want to affix your nameplate: Kharge to PM on Manikarnika Ghat redevelopment
content: Protestors have opposed a demolition drive under the redevelopment plan of the Manikarnika Ghat and alleged damage to a century-old idol of Ahilyabai Holkar, a charge refuted by the district administration

title: Supreme Court stays Kolkata Police probe into ED officers, says ‘lawlessness’ may creep into other States
content: A Bench of Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and Vipul Pancholi said they intend to issue notice and examine the matter. “This is a very serious matter; we will issue a notice. We have to examine it,” it remarked orally.

title: Mehbooba Mufti wants Centre's intervention for safe return of students from Iran
content: According to estimates, a little over 10,000 Indians, including students, are currently living in Iran

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Opposition raises concerns over marker pens used instead of indelible ink, BMC to probe complaints
content: The ink on the finger after voting can be removed with a sanitiser. Instead of ink, pens are being used after voting, says Maharashta Navnirman Sena (MNS) Chief Raj Thackeray

title: Two sports trainees found dead in hostel in Kerala
content: The reason for the deaths is yet to be ascertained; police will record statements from other sportspersons in the hostel, their trainers and relatives, an official said

title: Indian Army stands as steadfast shield of nation: Kharge
content: On Indian Army Day, we bow in reverence and gratitude to our brave soldiers, veterans, ex-servicemen and their families, says Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge

title: President Murmu, PM Modi hail Indian armed forces personnel on Army Day
content: PM Modi said the country remembers with deep respect those who have laid down their lives in the line of duty

title: At least five killed, ten injured in van-tractor collision in Bhopal
content: A pickup van headed for Narmadapuram and the tractor trolley collided head-on, Berasia police station inspector in-charge Vijendra Sen said

title: Voting across 29 Maharashtra civic bodies complete amid row over ink removal from fingers
content: Around 50% polling recorded, as per State Election Commissioner; vote count will take place on January 16

title: How are cryptocurrency exchanges in India vetting customers? | Explained
content: Cryptocurrency exchanges in India use a range of methods to verify their customers and prevent money-laundering and the financing of terrorism

title: Air India, IndiGo international flights impacted by Iran airspace closure
content: Air India said in a statement that some flights where currently rerouting is not possible are being cancelled

title: Maharashtra civic polls updates: Voting complete amid row over removing 'indelible' ink; voter turnout around 50%, SEC says
content: Maharashtra SEC Dinesh Waghmare said viral videos showing people removing ink from their fingers after casting vote are under investigation

title: Uproar as rats roam near beds, oxygen pipes in Gonda Hospital; Opposition raises concern for patient safety
content: With the video going viral, the Opposition alleged that the health infrastructure in the State is in a shambles

title: City coughs, sputters, as Bhogi fires burn; 4 stations record poor air quality
content: TNPCB data showed that in the 24 hours ending 8 a.m. on Tuesday, four stations out of 15, registered poor air quality

title: Villagers in Odisha seek restoration of land as thermal power plant fails to take off
content: They alleged corporate went into liquidation and right to transfer land parcels was given to another company without taking them into confidence

title: Bihar Chief Secretary makes geo-spatial approval mandatory for DPRs of infra projects above ₹50 crore
content: Departments were instructed to incorporate geo-spatial inputs at the planning stage itself to avoid technical, administrative, and land-related obstacles at later stages.

title: Indore water contamination: Medical panel pegs death toll at 15
content: The panel, consisting of five doctors from the government-run Mahatma Gandhi Medical (MGM) College, has submitted a report to the State authorities confirming 15 deaths even as the official figure remains at six

title: Political parties make pitch for 2027 Punjab election at Maghi Mela
content: AAP govt. will make provision in budget to give ₹1,000 per month to every woman, says Mann; Akali Dal chief lists poll promises; BJP holds first independent political rally at annual gathering

title: Suvendu warns West Bengal CM of legal action over coal scam remarks
content: In a post on X, the Leader of the Opposition claimed that the deadline given to Mamata Banerjee to respond to a defamation notice served by him had expired

title: Tej Pratap urges younger brother Tejashwi Yadav to merge RJD into his party
content: He said this on the occasions of Dahi-Chura feast which he has organised at his residence in Patna. Even his father and RJD Chief Lalu Prasad also attended the feast who had once expelled him from the party and snapped even family ties with him.

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | From melody to motion, students dazzle on festival stage
content: The 64th State School Arts Festival opens in Thrissur with dazzling performances by high school girls in the light music contest, alongside Mohiniyattam, group dance, and myriad art forms. Thousands of participants and spectators celebrate the talent, culture, and rich artistic heritage.

title: Union Minister welcomes INSV Kaundinya crew at Muscat port
content: Azzan Al Busaidi, under secretary, Tourism, Ministry of Heritage and Tourism of Oman, along with senior dignitaries from the Indian Navy, Royal Navy of Oman, Royal Oman Police Coast Guard, and other ministries were present.

title: Lokayukta registers case over ₹200 crore  government land scam in Nagamangala taluk
content: The accused include serving and former government officials and private individuals. A  criminal case has been registered against 11 persons in connection with the scam, and five government officials have been arrested.

title: Conditions favourable for cessation of NE monsoon; fog to continue in A.P.
content: Except for two, districts in Andhra Pradesh have either recorded excess or normal rainfall during south-west and north-east monsoon seasons

title: Centre asks A.P. to expand PPP model to ensure better healthcare services
content: State Health Secretary receives a letter containing suggestions in key areas of nuclear medicine, radiology, cancer daycare centres, dental clinics and mobile medical units

title: Dodgers strike again, land Tucker, sources say
content: The World Series champion Dodgers added another big bat to an already-potent lineup Thursday night, agreeing to a four-year, $240 million deal with prized free agent Kyle Tucker, sources told ESPN.

title: Dozens charged with college hoops point shaving
content: A college basketball point-shaving scheme involving more than 39 players on 17 teams resulted in dozens of games in the previous two seasons being fixed by a gambling ring that included a former NBA player, according to a federal indictment.

title: Darnold expects to play despite new oblique injury
content: Sam Darnold expects to play Saturday in the team's divisional round playoff game against the 49ers despite being added to the injury report Thursday with an oblique injury.

title: Vandy LB among 5 denied injunction for 5th year
content: Five college football players seeking to play a fifth season this fall had their motions for a preliminary injunction denied Thursday by a federal judge.

title: Philly GM: 'Hard to find great players' like Brown
content: Eagles GM Howie Roseman said players such as A.J. Brown are in short supply when asked if he would be open to trading the star wide receiver this offseason.

title: Oklahoma QB Mateer, LB Lewis to return in '26
content: Oklahoma quarterback John Mateer and linebacker Kip Lewis will return in 2026, the school announced on Thursday.

title: Nacua's brother won't be charged after taking car
content: Samson Nacua, the brother of Rams wide receiver Puka Nacua, will not be charged after he was arrested last month for allegedly taking a vehicle without the owner's consent, with investigators now telling ABC7 that they believe it was accidental.

title: Rory: LIV not signing anyone who moves needle
content: Even if LIV Golf spends hundreds of millions of dollars to re-sign two-time U.S. Open winner Bryson DeChambeau, PGA Tour star Rory McIlroy said he doesn't believe the Saudi Arabian-financed breakaway league will be any better off.

content: The Giants are finalizing a deal for John Harbaugh to become their next coach. It has been a rough decade for New York, but this hire could finally turn the tide.

title: Trade Deal On Cards As EU Leaders Visit India For Republic Day Celebrations
content: New Delhi is preparing for a high-stakes diplomatic and economic moment as India and the European Union move to clinch a long-pending Free Trade Agreement (FTA) during the 16th India-EU Summit on January 27.

title: BMC Results: BJP Alliance Has Edge In Early Leads, Thackerays Close Behind
content: The counting of votes has begun for elections to 29 civic bodies in Maharashtra, including the high-stakes battle in Mumbai and Pune. While Thackeray cousins are trying to retain the BMC, the reunited Pawars are hoping to defend their Pune citadel.

title: India Sees Strong 3rd Quarter Growth, IMF Likely To Hike GDP Forecast

title: Mehul Choksi's Son 'Actively' Involved In Money Laundering: Probe Agency ED
content: Rohan Choksi's name, however, had neither appeared in any First Information Report (FIR) nor has he been made an accused in any money laundering case registered by the CBI or the ED.

title: PM Modi Appeals People To Read Tirukkural On Thiruvalluvar Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday appealed to everyone to read Tirukkural, a classic Tamil treatise on various aspects of life.

title: Saudi, Qatar, Oman, Egypt: Arab States Rallying Against US-Iran Escalation
content: Four Arab states conducted intense diplomacy with the United States and Iran this week to prevent a threatened US attack on Iran over Tehran's use of force against protesters that they feared would have impacts across the region.

title: "Wonderful Gesture": Trump As Machado Presents Him Her Nobel Peace Prize
content: US President Donald Trump finally received a Nobel Peace Prize medal from Venezuela's opposition leader Maria Corina Machado.

title: Gates Foundation Unveils $9 Billion Budget And Plans To Cut Staff
content: The Gates Foundation announced Wednesday that it will spend a record $9 billion in 2026, maximising its spending in key areas such as global health.

title: "No Hesitation, No Compromise": Zubeen Garg's Wife Seeks Full Truth
content: Breaking her silence for the first time since details of the death of Assam's celebrated singer Zubeen Garg were placed before a Singapore court, his wife Garima Saikia Garg on Thursday issued a comprehensive public statement.

title: Delhi Increases Night Shelter Capacity Near AIIMS, GB Pant Amid Severe Cold
content: As a biting winter chill tightened its grip on the capital, the Delhi government on Thursday moved to expand night shelter facilities around AIIMS-Safdarjung and GB Pant Hospital, stepping up late-night rescue drives to move homeless people off the

title: Venezuela's Machado Presents Nobel Peace Prize To Trump During Meeting
content: President Donald Trump is meeting Thursday at the White House with Venezuelan opposition leader Mara Corina Machado, whose political party is widely considered to have won 2024 elections rejected by then-President Nicols Maduro.

title: Anti-Terror Agency Arrests Accused In 2021 CPI Maoist Conspiracy Case
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Thursday arrested an absconding accused in a 2021 CPI (Maoist) conspiracy case involving attempts to re-energise the banned terrorist organisation in the Magadh Zone, the agency said in a press release.

title: NEET Aspirant's Suspicious Death In Patna Hostel Sparks Tension; 1 Arrested
content: After the suspicious death of a NEET aspirant, Patna Police arrested the owner of the hostel on Thursday, an official said.

title: Mayawati Says BSP To Contest All Elections Alone, Including 2027 UP Polls
content: BSP president Mayawati on Thursday said her party will contest all elections across the country, including the 2027 Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls, on its own, and it would form a government with a full majority in the state.

title: US Slaps Sweeping Sanctions On Iran Over Protest Crackdown
content: The US announced a far-reaching new round of sanctions against Iran, targeting senior security officials, a notorious prison accused of abusing detainees, and a sprawling network of front companies used to launder billions of dollars from oil.

title: Iran Halted 800 Protester Executions: White House
content: Iran halted 800 executions under pressure from President Donald Trump over its crackdown on a wave of protests, but US military action remains an option, the White House said Thursday.

title: Yemen's Prime Minister Quits, Replaced By Foreign Minister
content: Yemen's Saudi-backed presidential leadership council has accepted the resignation of Prime Minister Salem bin Breik and appointed Foreign Minister Shaya Mohsen Zindani as the country's new prime minister, state news agency Saba reported on Thursday.
